Authors: Tjhin V.U., Tavakoli R., Robertus Nugroho P.A.
Title: The determinants affecting e-loyalty: Hospitality industry in Indonesia
Source title: Proceeding - 2016 2nd International Conference on Science in Information Technology, ICSITech 2016: Information Science for Green Society and Environment
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tjhin, V.U., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tavakoli, R., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Robertus Nugroho, P.A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this study was to determine the effect of e-marketing and e-service quality on e-satisfaction and its impact on e-loyalty. This research was conducted on customers in Jakarta. Data were collected from a sample of 100 respondents. The data were analyzed using path analysis. The result of this study found that e-marketing did not affect the e-satisfaction. E-marketing and e-service quality had an influence on e-satisfaction. E-satisfaction had an influence on e-loyalty. E-marketing and e-service did not influence e-loyalty. Based on the results of this study, we suggested that hotels should develop their website with interesting and detailed features for e-marketing and also provide live chat service for increasing e-service quality. E-satisfaction can be supported by customer satisfaction surveys on a regular basis or to be a part of the standard operating procedure, whereas customer loyalty programs need to be developed in the near future to build customers' e-loyalty. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Marketing; Publishing; Quality of service; Regression analysis; Sales; Customer loyalty programs; Customer satisfaction survey; E-loyalty; E-marketing; E-satisfaction; E-service quality; Hospitality industry; Standard operating procedures; Customer satisfaction
